conclusion: Need to analyze the flow pattern and positions of liquid streams to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The liquid streams are shown as colored lines.
The streams are moving from left to right.
The streams are directed towards the right side of the image.
Streams A, B, and C are shown to flow out from different points.
Stream A is shown to flow out from point A.
Stream B is shown to flow out from point B.
Stream C is shown to flow out from point C.
The streams are moving from left to right.
The streams are directed towards the right side of the image.
Container D is positioned on the left side of the image.
Container E is positioned on the right side of the image.

Since the streams are moving from left to right and are directed towards the right side of the image, the liquid will flow out from the left side of the image (container D) and into the right side of the image (container E).
The liquid will flow into container E.
